intro: Echium giganteum f. aculeata, commonly known as the spiny giant thistle, is a striking member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its large, spiny leaves and showy purple-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to the Iberian Peninsula and thrives in rocky or coastal environments. Its fleshy stems and hairy foliage are adaptations to arid conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
